items.name: Creatine
items.description: A molecule that is naturally created within the human body that provides energy for muscles. Dietary supplementation may increase this content by up to 40%.

items.name: Beta-Alanine
items.description: An amino acid found in the body. Supplementing this may help reduce fatigue and improve workout performance.

items.name: BCAAs
items.description: Known as Branched-Chain Amino Acids, these are a mixture of the leucine, isoleucine, and valine amino acids which may aid in muscle recovery. When supplemented, this may help reduce post workout fatigue.

items.name: Protein Powder
items.description: Multiple amino acids ground up into powder form to help muscles rebuild. Supplement this when daily protein intake is low.

items.name: Caffeine
items.description: A stimulant for the central nervous system that rids the mind of feeling tired. Helps boost energy levels temporarily.

items.name: Glutamine
items.description: One of the most common amino acids inside the human body, Glutamine offers fuel for cells. May help boost endurance and later reduce fatigue.

items.name: Carnitine
items.description: A compound found in the mitochondria of cells which helps transport fatty acids to be used as energy.

items.name: Fish Oil
items.description: High in Omega-3 fatty acids, fish oil is claimed to support the heart and cardiovascular system and lower triglyceride production in the body to prevent diseases.

items.name: Citrulline
items.description: Another amino acid known for promoting endurance and blood flow.
